name: WaterFire Providence
description: A captivating art installation featuring over 80 bonfires burning on the rivers of downtown Providence, accompanied by music and performances.

name: RISD Museum
description: The art museum of the Rhode Island School of Design featuring over 100,000 works spanning ancient to contemporary art.

name: Federal Hill
description: Providence's Little Italy, known for its authentic Italian restaurants, bakeries, and the iconic DePasquale Square fountain.

name: Prospect Terrace Park
description: A scenic overlook park offering panoramic views of downtown Providence, perfect for sunset watching and photos.

name: Roger Williams Park Zoo
description: One of the oldest zoos in the country featuring over 100 species, a carousel, and beautiful botanical gardens.

name: Thayer Street
description: A vibrant college street near Brown University filled with eclectic shops, international restaurants, and cafes.

name: Providence Performing Arts Center
description: A historic 1928 theater palace hosting Broadway shows, concerts, and performances in an opulent setting.

name: Benefit Street
description: A mile-long historic street known as the 'Mile of History' featuring beautifully preserved 18th and 19th-century homes.

name: India Point Park
description: A waterfront park at the confluence of the Seekonk and Providence Rivers, perfect for walking, biking, and enjoying harbor views.

name: The Arcade Providence
description: America's oldest indoor shopping mall, now featuring micro-lofts on upper floors and unique local shops and eateries below.

name: First Works Festival
description: Providence's annual performing arts festival showcasing innovative theater, dance, music, and multimedia performances.

name: Brown University Campus
description: Explore the beautiful Ivy League campus with its historic buildings, green spaces, and the famous Van Wickle Gates.

name: Downtown Providence Art Walk
description: Self-guided tour of the city's vibrant public art scene, including murals, sculptures, and installations by local artists.

name: Providence Flea
description: A curated outdoor market featuring vintage finds, handmade goods, artisanal foods, and live music along the river.

name: John Brown House
description: A magnificent 1788 mansion offering guided tours that showcase Providence's merchant elite and colonial history.
